Well, I created another FetchHTTP in my package, exact source but that
method commented out but I runned into this now:

Time:   	 Sep. 15, 2006 08:38:59 GMT
Level:  	SEVERE
Message:  	

Serious error occured trying to process 'CrawlURI dns:www.w3.org P
http://www.w3.org/2000/PhotoRDF/technical-1-0 in Archiver'
[ToeThread #12: dns:www.w3.org
 CrawlURI dns:www.w3.org P
http://www.w3.org/2000/PhotoRDF/technical-1-0    0 attempts
    in processor: Archiver
    ACTIVE for 94ms
    step: ABOUT_TO_BEGIN_PROCESSOR for 0ms

    java.lang.Thread.getStackTrace(Unknown Source)

    org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.reportTo(ToeThread.java:593)
    org.archive.util.DevUtils.extraInfo(DevUtils.java:65)

]

28192          0.0           0           0
 (in thread 'ToeThread #12: dns:www.w3.org'; in processor 'Archiver')

org.apache.commons.pool.impl.GenericObjectPool._pool from class
org.apache.commons.pool.impl.FairGenericObjectPool
Stacktrace: java.lang.IllegalAccessError: tried to access field
org.apache.commons.pool.impl.GenericObjectPool._pool from class
org.apache.commons.pool.impl.FairGenericObjectPool
	at org.apache.commons.pool.impl.FairGenericObjectPool.borrowObject(FairGenericObjectPool.java:207)
	at org.archive.io.WriterPool.borrowFile(WriterPool.java:139)
	at org.archive.crawler.writer.ARCWriterProcessor.write(ARCWriterProcessor.java:169)
	at org.archive.crawler.writer.ARCWriterProcessor.innerProcess(ARCWriterProcessor.java:143)

And I have no other org.apache.commons.pool.* whereever in tomcat :(

Not using ARCWriter it seems OK, but in my writer now:
RecordingInputStream recis = curi.getHttpRecorder().getRecordedInput();
recis.getResponseContentLength() => 0

So I suppose that the above error in ARCWriter may be from a 0
response? All this using my FetchHTTP...

Probably if I'll sort out the FetchHTTP issue all will be OK.

Any ideas?
-- 
Laurian Gridinoc, purl.org/net/laur
